name: Clarinet - CSW
description: Cinematic Studio Woodwinds Clarinet. Warm, flexible tone with exceptional dynamic range. Versatile for both melodic solos and orchestral blend.

legato.description: Legato is for MONO parts only - smooth transition between single notes. Enable legato (velocity ≥64) when playing single melodic lines. Disable legato (velocity <64) when 2+ notes sound simultaneously. Re-enable when returning to mono. Prefer keyswitch over CC for legato control.

orchestration_hints.character: Warm, flexible, chameleon-like. The most versatile woodwind. Can be dark, bright, or silky.
best_for: Sustained harmonic notes in chalumeau register

register_character.low_chalumeau: D3-G3: Dark, rich, mysterious. Very distinctive.
register_character.throat: G3-Bb3: Weaker, transition zone. Use carefully.
register_character.clarion: B3-C6: Bright, clear, brilliant. Primary melodic range.

ensemble_tips: Widest dynamic range of woodwinds - use it
Low register blends beautifully with bassoon
Clarion register doubles well with violins
Can play softer than any other wind instrument
Excellent for fast passages and arpeggios
avoid: Heavy use when warmth is needed (use horn instead)

ai.system_prompt_template: Generate clarinet parts for Cinematic Studio Woodwinds. Use CC1 for dynamics on long articulations, velocity for short articulations. LEGATO: Keyswitch Ab1 toggles legato (velocity ≥64 on, <64 off). IMPORTANT: Legato is for MONO parts only - use it for smooth note-to-note transitions in single melodic lines. Disable legato before any polyphonic passages (2+ simultaneous notes), re-enable when returning to mono melody. Switch articulations via CC58. Playable range D3-Bb6, preferred E3-G6.
